page.title: 03FARMING AND FISHING
page.content: The area is mainly pastoral land used for beef cattle,dairy cows and sheep. Many of the cows are Friesian and some of the sheep are from the Lake District to winter in this area because of its unusually mild winters. A small part of the area is devoted to market gardening with the produce sold at the Barrow and Ulverston markets. Vegetables grown include potatoes, cabbages and turnips.Farming is mainly run as a family business with little necessity for hired help.The working day is normally the 12 hours from 6a.m. to 6p.m. Farm buildings are built mainly from carboniferous limestone but with some built from beach pebbles cemented together.Since some of the land is very wet,deep drainage ditches augment hedges and barbed wire as field boundaries.
